questions.question: The following function is intended to compute n! (factorial). It behaves incorrectly for some inputs. Identify which issues may be present in the code below.
answers: Function uses '<' leading to an off-by-one: loop should include n
It converts the final result to str instead of returning an int
It multiplies by i where it should add i
Passing string arguments will cause errors
Initialization of i should start at 0 instead of 1
Function only works with a for loop, not a while loop
